intro: Onosma bulgarica, commonly known as Bulgarian sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Onosma bulgarica is often found in open landscapes such as steppes and forest edges.
